citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On June 19, 2023 animal care staff discovered that 2 non human primates had not received their approved amount of
water on June 18, 2023 . These animals were on an approved IACUC protocol ( 2022 - 000109 ) that allows for water
restriction ,however the protocol does not allow for withholding water. Water was immediately provided to the animals and
a veterinary exam revealed the animals suffered no distress or dehydration.
Failure to follow the approved protocol’s directions may affect the health and well-being of the animals. This is a deviation
from the activities regarding the care and use of animals that the IACUC reviewed and approved. The IACUC must
ensure that all activities related to the care and use of animals are reviewed and approved. All staff involved in the matter
received retraining as a corrective measure and now a water log is required and checked daily by 2 staff members.
CORRECTED on 1/29/2024
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the attending veterinarian and facility employees.
Additional Inspectors:
ELIZABETH PANNILL, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
